pronunciation:
PLAT, [from plait, or plat flat.]
To [Latin latus; or from the root of place.]

definitions.text:
Plat
 [from plait, or plat flat.]
To weave; to form by texture. Matthew 27:29.
PLAT,

A small piece of ground, usually portion of flat even ground; as flowery plat; plat of willows.
PLAT,

Plainly; flatly; downright. [Not used.]
1. Smoothly; evenly. [Not used.]
